node.title: Epidemiologist sounds warning ahead of WA border reopening call
node.alt: People wear face masks outside Royal Perth Hospital.
node.description: A leading West Australian epidemiologist warns Mark McGowan to reconsider opening the state's border early next year as the Omicron COVID-19 variant continues to sparkÂ concern.
node.content:
["A leading West Australian epidemiologist has warned the state's Premier Mark McGowan to reconsider opening the state's border early next year as the Omicron COVID-19 variant continues to spark\u00a0concern.", "University of Western Australia epidemiologist Zoe Hyde said she was \"more concerned now that I have been since any time during the pandemic\" because so little was known about the new variant.", "\"It [Omicron]\u00a0has really thrown a spanner in the works,\" she told ABC Radio Perth.", "\"And I really think it would be quite unwise to continue with the plan as is. I think it needs some modification at least.\"", "Mr McGowan is\u00a0due to announce the state's reopening date today, expected to be early next year.", "
Delay WA border reopening date
", "Once the state reopens, international and interstate travel will resume, with testing and vaccination requirements.", "Some restrictions would be introduced to help manage the spread of COVID-19 in WA, including face masks for some high-risk indoor settings and proof of vaccination for large events, nightclubs and the casino.\u00a0", "The date is expected to be set for late January or early February, with the state government hopeful of reaching 90 per cent full vaccination across the over-12 cohort by then.", "", "
Dr Zoe Hyde believes too little is currently known about Omicron to allow the state to safely open its borders.(Supplied: University of Western Australia)
", "But Dr Hyde said it would be prudent to allow more time to watch how the new variant played out in the eastern states.", "\"In particular, we need to know how well our vaccines are going to hold up against it,\" she said.", "Dr Hyde said she was concerned about the need for booster shots to better protect people against Omicron.\u00a0", "Omicron does not appear to be more severe than other virus variants, but it is hoped fast-tracking boosters will cover waning immunity levels as it spreads.", "\"I think our existing plan would have worked if we were facing the Delta variant,\" Dr Hyde said.", "\"But I think the conditions are very different now.", "\"I think we should be postponing the reopening until we have better data on what the Omicron variant is likely to do. There is really no need to rush this.", "\"No one wants to see lockdowns.\"", "
Call for quarantine to continue
", "Dr Hyde said she would like to see an extension of quarantine requirements.", "\"Whether that is the existing formal system we have with the hotel quarantine system, or whether it is some form of home quarantine,\" she said.", "\"But I think we need to have something there, rather just have the borders completely open.\"", "Dr Hyde said she would have liked to see three-dose vaccination across the eligible population before opening for quarantine-free travel.", "She also wanted to see more measures introduced in WA schools, such as HEPA filters.", "\"If we open with our current levels of vaccination, I think the virus is going to spread like wildfire.\u00a0", "\"We are looking at hundreds, probably more likely thousands of hospitalisations. Probably hundreds of deaths.\u00a0", "\"I think that is so unnecessary. We are in an incredibly fortunate situation in the world.", "\"There are very few places that are in the position that Western Australia is in.", "\"I think many people overseas will be looking at us as if we're mad.\u00a0", "\"We're poised to snatch defeat from the jaws of victory.\"", "
Modelling predicts deaths, hospitalisations
", "The WA Department of Health modelling, which was based on the Delta variant, predicted 43,108 COVID-19 cases after one year of re-opening with 90 per cent vaccination coverage.", "It predicted 937 general ward hospital admissions, 106 ICU admissions and 117 deaths across that period.\u00a0", "Last week Professor Catherine Bennett, the chair of epidemiology at Deakin University, said new variants could be managed without closing state borders.\u00a0", "", "
Health Minister Roger Cook and Premier Mark McGowan pushed vaccination rates with the Roll Up WA campaign.(ABC News)
", "\"Living with the virus does not just mean living with the virus in our community, it actually means living with the virus in our world, and knowing that includes the possibility that we will see more variants,\" she said.", "\"Having some strategies in place that allow us to keep some controls on new variants, whether it is actually screening international arrivals and making tighter rules around isolation until we understand a new variant, you might need to do that if new variants emerge.", "\"But we should not have to keep closing borders every time, and certainly not internal borders.", "\"We are in a position to control the virus locally and we are part of a world response to this virus.", "\"We can learn about a virus without shutting things down completely. We will get more variants emerging so we have to learn how to do that.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
